titlestmt.titleproper: Philadelphia Sunday School Association Missionary Committee records 1855-1860
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Philadelphia Sunday School Association Missionary Committee records

bioghist.p: The Philadelphia Sunday School Association Missionary Committee was a multi-denominational group formed to encourage and support Sunday schools in churches in the city of Philadelphia and its vicinity.

scopecontent.p: This is a volume of minutes of the Missionary Committee of the Philadelphia Sunday School, 1855-1860. The minutes contain reports of the Committee's agents' and Lady visitors' visits to Sunday schools of various churches (Presbyterian, Lutheran, Methodist Episcopal, and Baptist) throughout the city, and discussions about finding locations for Sunday school classes and the general health of Sunday schools in the Philadelphia area.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
